dt.t: … proceeded to {wi}attire{/wi} herself for a professional visit.
The guests were formally {wi}attired{/wi}. {gloss}=wearing formal clothing{/gloss}

dt: {bc}to clothe in fancy or rich garments

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}atirer{/it} to equip, prepare, attire, from {it}a-{/it} (from Latin {it}ad-{/it}) + {it}tire{/it} order, rank, of Germanic origin; akin to Old English {it}tīr{/it} glory, ornament
shortdef: to put garments on : dress, array; especially : to clothe in fancy or rich garments

dt: {bc}the antlers or antlers and scalp of a stag or buck

shortdef: dress, clothes; especially : splendid or decorative clothing
the antlers or antlers and scalp of a stag or buck
